qas.question: What kind of locomotion is seen in stick insects?
What is another name for walking stick insects?
Some insects can walk on top of what?
What insect can walk on the surface of water?
Water striders are part of what insect family?

context: Cockroaches are among the fastest insect runners and, at full speed, adopt a bipedal run to reach a high velocity in proportion to their body size. As cockroaches move very quickly, they need to be video recorded at several hundred frames per second to reveal their gait. More <a0_0>sedate<a0_0/> locomotion is seen in the stick insects or walking sticks (<a1_0>Phasmatodea<a1_0/>). A few insects have evolved to walk on the surface of the <a2_0>water<a2_0/>, especially members of the <a4_0>Gerridae<a4_0/> family, commonly known as <a3_0>water striders<a3_0/>. A few species of ocean-skaters in the genus Halobates even live on the surface of open oceans, a habitat that has few insect species.
